channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report E-2024070001
item.description:
Report E-2024070001

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2024, three (3) 50-pound bags of UN2680 were ripped by a forklift and released approximately three (3) pounds of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE used hand tools to collect all spilled product and remediated the impacted dock floor with cleaners and absorbents. All spent absorbents and impacted debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged onsite for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024061901
item.description:
Report X-2024061901

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-02T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: ROSWELL
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DRIVER NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. NOTIFIED RMP OF POTENTIAL LEAKING HAZMAT ON DRIVERS CAR. RMP GATHERED PPE AND OTHER RESPONSE SUPPLIES AND TRAVELLED TO PACKAGE LOCATION. UPON ARRIVAL FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND DONNED PPE, RESPONDED USING THE CORROSIVE SHEET, RMP INSPECTED PACKAGE, SECURED AND CLEANED UP ACCORDING TO RESPONSE SHEET AND TRANSPORTED PACKAGE BACK TO SERVICE CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. PACKAGE WAS WET FROM THE INSIDE AND NO EVIDENCE OF ANY OTHER LEAKAGE BESIDES WET CARDBOARD ON THE BOX. CAP OF INSIDE CONTAINER WAS TIGHT, NO SEAL UNDER CAP.

item.title: Report X-2024061795
item.description:
Report X-2024061795

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-08
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 275000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Remote control locomotive operator free rolled 5 load tank cars from the switching lead into class track 20 which struck tank car CTCX 730096. The B-end stub sill buckled causing the tank shell to crush in on itself. The B-end head shoe pulled the outer most point of repad off the tank shell. The repad continued to be pulled away from the tank shell towards the center of the car until the tank shell tore vertically at the body bolster.

item.title: Report E-2024060611
item.description:
Report E-2024060611

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 17, 2024, one (1) 35-gallon pail of UN1789 was punctured and released approximately 29-gallons of product to the trailer floor, adjacent cargo, and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) 95-gallon OP. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site and containerized all impacted material in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal. On June 18, 2024, FCE returned to continue remediation. Crews removed the impacted wooden pallets and packaging materials. All impacted debris was containerized as waste in two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged onsite for disposal. On June 20, 2024, FCE returned to the site to further over pack the affected cargo of four (4) 55-gallon fiber drums. Crews collected and containerized the four (4) fiber drums into four (4) 95-gallon over pack poly drums and staged them onsite for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024061195
item.description:
Report X-2024061195

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: NS Intermodal ramp personnel reported an unidentified flammable liquid leaking from FDUX 536129. There was no impact to waterways and there was no injuries noted. It was determined that 1 of 4 totes was ruptured due to load shift and had leaked to empty. All of the contents were placed on poly next to the vessel. The tote in question was isolated and wrapped in poly.
